intro: Scyphopetalum ramiflorum, commonly known as the branched-flower scyphopetalum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its unique floral structure and adaptability to various climates contribute to its horticultural value.
